From: Jared Isaacman
Sent: Friday, May 08, 2015 4:47 PM
To: Angelo Grecco; Bob Carr; Jonathan R Abolfotouh
Cc: Jeffrey Shanahan
Subject: RE: Connect - Updated Term Sheet - Very Confidential
All,

I wanted to share my current thinking at a high level as it seems we are close to reaching an agreement in principle. I will follow up with
responses to your comments shortly.

As you know, we always take a very conservative approach to acquisitions:
• We keep the teams lean. We don't believe in acquiring a lot of staff.
• Our purchase price calculations have always been driven more from a cost-to-build perspective than from a revenue multiple.
• We do not put a lot of value in contracts - especially where the pricing within the terms of the cont ract can change.
• We are on record and it is out in the public domain that we have considered companies like Merchant Link and their gateway services
replaceable in the $5-7M range from a cost-to-build perspective.

That said, the CardConnect gateway, customer base and IP is certainly worth more than a cost-to-build in the range I mentioned above. We
also, as you know, very much want CardConnect to clear its transactions through the MercuryPay network. You also have a lot of merchants
going through your gateway which we are prepared to get very aggressive on (and I will cover that in a Credit Facility later in this email). You
have an existing and very profitable book of business with First Data, are one of their largest distribution partners, and one of very few
using their latest technologies - like TransArmor. CardConnect has a talented and rather unique sales team. You have many next gen ISV
integrations that represent great reseller revenue opportunities in the near term. These all have a lot of value that will benefit Shift4 but are
hard to accurately factor into a typical valuation mod el which, on past deals, would be largely based on what CardConnect looked like
stand-alone.

So, in order to realize the mutual benefits to both Shift4 and CardConnect, I am approaching the valuation a bit different as you will see
below:
• Purchase Price:
o $45M (this is a slight increase from my last communication)
o Additional $7.5M in earn-outs based on performance achievements (this is a slight increase from my last communication)
o Total: $52.5M
• Structure
o Shift4 will acquire the following assets:
 The IP associated with the CardConnect gateway
 All customer and vendor contracts
• The existing vendor agreement between CardConnect and Shift4 will be terminated without penalty to CardConnect.
• The existing vendor agreement between CardConnect and Merchant Link will be renegotiated with comparable functionality
at the same rates as available to Shift4 under the new Merchant Link enterprise agreement.
• CardConnect will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Shift4 under the name "CardConnect, a Shift4 Company".
• The entity name change is intended to benefit sales/marketing initiatives.
o Excluded Assets
 Approximately ~ 20 integrations to CardConnect (and I can provide this list) that conflict with Shift4's core business will
be divested at the time of closing to a holding company owned in large part by the existing CardConnect shareholders.
This will give the shareholders an opportunity to put resources into developing the 20 ISV opportunities without conflict
to Shift4.
 The existing sales organization
 Cash, AR and AP will be retained by the existing CardConnect ownership.
o Employees:
 Essentially all of your technology and operations team will be asked to join CardConnect, a Shift4 Company.
• The technology team will be critical to supporting the CardConnect gateway as well as enhancing it with 4Go and other Shift4
technologies.
• The operations team will be needed to support and grow the gateway business.
 I will be making offers to your leadership team, such as Angelo and Jon, to run CardConnect, a Shift4 Company.
 Your sales leadership team has an option to join CardConnect, a Shift4 Company, and be eligible for incentives/bonuses
being extended to my inside sales team (which is very generous) or focus exclusively on supporting the ~20 integration
opportunities that are being divested to the holding company.
 A list of the employees that will be made offers is attached so you can see we are capturing nearly the organization
associated with the gateway.
• Credit Facility:
o Shift4 has a $100M credit facility to complete acquisitions, which will largely go unused as a result of this transaction structure,
as well as commit funds to initiatives that complement our core business.
o I want to carve out $10M to deliver to CardConnect, a Shift4 Company, for two purposes:
 $5M will be used to accelerate the new volume onboarding to the gateway to benefit from our "out of market" (meaning
non-M ercuryPay) processing economics, which you will see on Addendum A, increase more rapidly.
 $5M will be used to enable a more seamless migration of CardConnect merchants over time to the MercuryPay platform,
which we all believe has the potential for CardConnect sales to exceed 7,500 merchant accounts per year (our current
sales). At an average of 400 terminals per account, this results in 3M terminals (we estimate an account as 400 terminals
based on current distribution). We think your team, your technology, your experience, and with the help of the initiatives
mentioned throughout, will be able to exceed this number in 18 months.

My hope is that this shows the value of what CardConnect is bringing to Shift4 in our willingness to significantly exceed our last valuation
and deviate from our traditional deal structure which can be rather limiting.

I will follow up shortly.

Best Regards,

Jared
Jared Isaacman
Chief Executive Officer
Shift4 Corporation

September 4, 2018,11:15 AM
JARED ISAACMAN
Angelo Grecco

Angelo,

I am sorry to keep pressing this and I fully realize you are on vacation and I really
appreciate you always picking up.

I do think you and the Card Connect team need to start appreciating the environment we
are now in and its not sustainable.

We bought the assets and all on-going support and maintenance obligations of
CardConnect for less than $30M net of holdbacks.

Between then and now, we have not received much help (some incremental revenue)
growing non-First Data gateway volume ... so all revenue/EBITDA upside we hoped would
emerge from this deal that would make it a big win has been delayed by a magnitude of
years. This is very problematic.

That said, we have still invested well over $30M into your new platform, supporting all of
your customers (and honoring your obligations to them) and taking many cost savings out
of the combined business to offset the losses you were running.

I have heard many complaints from my team on a variety of issues but I have defended
CardConnect and reminded them we entered into a deal and have to see it through.

I have become alarmed that the same sense of commitment does not exist at Card Connect.
We hear things from customers and partners. Our team is telling me they are hearing things.
There is a lack of urgency. We are operating like it is business as usual. It is not.

Please share this in the appropriate way with your team. Let's get on the right path.

Best Regards,

Jared

January 19, 2019
VIA EMAIL
Jared Isaacman
Shift4 Payments, LLC
2202 N. Irving Street
Allentown, PA 18109

Re: Notice of Material Breach of Asset Purchase Agreement
Dear Jared;
I am writing on behalf of Card Connect, LLC ("CardConnect') to provide notice that
Shift4 Payments, LLC and its subsidiary, Shift4 Corporation (collectively, 'Shift4"), are in
material breach of that certain Asset Purchase Agreement dated as of June 1, 2017 by and
between CardConnect and Shift4 (the "APA"). These material breaches and violations of
applicable law, as described below, have caused significant damages to CardConnect.
Moreover, Shift4's attempts to interfere with CardConnect's prospective business
relationships are ongoing.

As you know, Section 5.18 of the APA requires Shift4 to market and promote all
products and services offered by CardConnect as of the date of the agreement, including
without limitation CardConnect's CoPilot product, i.e., the portfolio management platform
used by independent sales organizations ("ISOs") to manage merchant processing
portfolios. Shift4 also agreed to preserve CardConnect's CoPilot contracts with its ISO
clients, and not to disparage CoPilot to those clients or to impede CardConnect's ability to
pursue full enforcement of its contracts. These obligations are especially significant given
that CardConnect contracts typically are for multiyear terms, with automatic annual renewals
absent a timely notice of non-renewal.

However, in the last several months, Shift4 has engaged in a concerted campaign of
wrongful conduct designed to undermine CardConnect's CoPilot business. Such conduct
includes, but is not limited to, (i) directly soliciting CardConnect's CoPilot clients before
their contracts can be renewed and inducing them to switch from CardConnect to Shift4 for
portfolio management; (ii) disparaging CardConnect's business and attempting to damage
CardConnect's valuable client and business relationships; (iii) inducing potential new ISO
clients to enter into contracts with Shift4 instead of CardConnect, causing the loss of
significant new revenue opportunities; (iv) improperly interfering with the ongoing
negotiations between CardConnect and its largest CoPilot client, Retriever, which resulted
in Retriever terminating its long-term and lucrative relationship with CardConnect; and (v)
engaging in improper and unfair competition by using confidential, proprietary and trade
secret information of CardConnect to solicit existing and potential customers and/or
undercut CardConnect's pricing.

Upon information and belief, Shift4's interference with CardConnect's largest client
has already resulted in estimated damages to CardConnect exceeding $500,000, with
additional damages accruing each day. Moreover, upon information and belief, Shift4's
unlawful conduct is ongoing. CardConnect has taken all reasonable steps to mitigate its
damages and intends to pursue every available legal and equitable remedy.
We hereby demand that Shift4 immediately cease and desist from the various
wrongful acts as set forth herein. In addition, we demand that Shift4 immediately comply
with the marketing and non-disparagement obligations under the APA. Finally, we
demand that Shift4 immediately provide us with all relevant information pertaining to its
business communications with all current and prospective CoPilot clients so that we can
fully and fairly assess the nature, extent, and specific sources of our damages, caused by
Shift4's material breaches of the APA and violations of state and federal law.

We reserve all rights to the full extent permitted by applicable law.
Sincerely,

/s/ Patrick Farley
Patrick Farley

Angelo,

 

I wanted to follow up on a few items since our last communication to you on the proposed transaction.

 

First, thank you for providing responses to my high level summary email.  It does seem that we are close to an agreement in principle.  That said, I do have follow up questions on a couple of your comments.

 

·                   In Item 2 of your response, can you provide more detail on the earn-out?  Can it be specific to include only the EBITDA that results from the growth in your non-First Data gateway and processing business?  That is what creates the greatest uplift for us and we want to incent the right performance.

Second, as promised please see below a list of the ISV relationships we need to divest in order for this transaction to proceed.  I did say ~20 previously but I was able to reduce this list a bit by including some in the proposed deal with Shift4.  We are working on minimizing this list further the last few days.

·                   InnLink

·                   Guestline

·                   XAiva

·                   Execu/Tech Systems

·                   RDPWin

·                   MSI

·                   Maestro

·                   IQWare

That is all for now.

 

Best Regards,

 

Jared

Subject: Shift4 Payments Announces End of CardConnect Reseller Program
Body:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

Shift4 Payments Announces End of CardConnect Reseller Program

ALLENTOWN, Pa. — May 29, 2020 — Shift4 Payments, a leading provider
of integrated payment processing solutions, has announced they will no longer be
supporting the CardConnect reseller program, effective immediately. This decision
was made in order to improve the overall merchant experience and better align
with Shift4’s long-term vision for partner success.
Shift4 Payments acquired CardConnect in 2018, at which point the company
began working to integrate the CardConnect platform, systems, and personnel with
their own. Shift4 Payments CEO Jared Isaacman stated, “For the last few years,
we have worked hard to consolidate the various acquisitions we have made over
time to deliver a single, unified payments platform for our partners and customers.
We are committed to eliminating complexities and the unnecessary costs that are
too common throughout the payments industry.”
Any new merchant accounts boarded through the CardConnect platform will
include a notice that the CardConnect program is no longer supported by Shift4
Payments and that the merchant may be contacted to convert to the Shift4
Payments platform.
Existing merchants boarded on the CardConnect platform prior to the acquisition
will not be impacted at this time, although Shift4 may reach out to offer conversion
incentives in the future.
ISOs, agents, and other sales partners who have utilized the CardConnect
reseller program are urged to contact Shift4 Payments directly to learn about
partnership opportunities with significantly enhanced economics on a much more
advanced and innovative platform. These integration enhancements include over
350+ integrations to a wide range of POS, PMS and e-commerce systems, a
proprietary gateway with EMV, contactless and mobile wallet acceptance, a robust
online reporting portal, and much more.

About Shift4 Payments
Shift4 Payments is a leading provider of integrated payment processing solutions.
Shift4’s groundbreaking technologies help power the top software providers in
numerous verticals, including hospitality, retail, F&B, e-commerce, lodging, gaming,
and many more. Shift4’s family of brands includes Harbortouch, Restaurant
Manager, POSitouch, and Future POS — with additional integrations to 300+ POS/PMS
systems across every industry. With an expansive global footprint that includes eight
offices across the U.S. and Europe and over 8,000 sales partners, the company
securely processes more than a billion transactions annually for nearly 200,000
businesses, representing over $200 billion in payments each year. To learn more,
visit shift4.com.
